title: One-Pan Apple Cider Chicken for Cozy Weeknights
promptIMG: One-Pan Apple Cider Glazed Chicken, on plate, natural food photography, balanced sharp focus, zero blur throughout entire image, infinite depth of field, realistic food textures, modern kitchen background in sharp focus, natural lighting, kitchen countertop visible, even focus distribution, documentary food photography, natural sharpness --no blur, depth of field, bokeh, over-sharpening, artificial enhancement --quality 2 --raw --stylize 300
description: This One-Pan Apple Cider Glazed Chicken is the perfect weeknight meal that brings warmth and flavor to your table. With its sweet and tangy glaze, it's a dish that will impress your family and friends. Try it tonight for a cozy dinner experience!
ingredients: 1 pound chicken thighs, boneless and skinless
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Season chicken thighs with salt, pepper, and thyme, then add to the skillet.
Cook chicken for about 5-7 minutes on each side until golden brown.
Remove chicken and set aside. In the same skillet, add onions and apple slices, sautÃ©ing until soft.
Pour in apple cider, scraping up any browned bits from the skillet.
Return chicken to the skillet, cover, and simmer for 10-15 minutes until cooked through.
tips: For perfect results, ensure the chicken is cooked to an internal temperature of 165Â°F. Let the dish rest for a few minutes before serving to enhance flavors.

structured_content.content: This One-Pan Apple Cider Glazed Chicken is a delightful dish that combines the sweetness of apple cider with savory chicken, creating a comforting meal perfect for cozy weeknights. The simplicity of cooking everything in one pan not only saves time but also enhances the flavors as they meld together.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 30 minutes
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home
  • Perfect for weeknight dinners and entertaining
  • Uses simple ingredients you likely have on hand
  • Great for fall gatherings with its seasonal flavors

structured_content.content: I remember the first time I made this dish; the aroma filled my kitchen, and my family couldn't wait to dig in. It's become a staple in our home, especially during the cooler months.

• Main ingredient: Chicken thighs are juicy and flavorful, making them perfect for this dish. Look for ones that are plump and fresh.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Thyme adds a lovely herbal note that complements the sweetness of the cider.
  • Supporting ingredients: Apples add a nice texture and sweetness, while onions provide depth of flavor.
  • Equipment needed: A large skillet is essential for cooking everything evenly.

upload.context: A short description for the alt image of the ingredients preparation.

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Start by seasoning the chicken thighs with salt, pepper, and thyme. Slice the onions and apples while the skillet heats up.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Cook the chicken until golden brown, then sautÃ© the onions and apples in the same skillet. Add apple cider and return the chicken to finish cooking.
Finishing Touches:
Let the dish rest for a few minutes before serving to allow the flavors to meld.

upload.context: A short description for the alt image of the cooking process.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Cook the chicken until it reaches an internal temperature of 165Â°F for safety.
  • Avoid overcrowding the pan to ensure even cooking.
  • Look for a golden brown color on the chicken as a sign of doneness.
  • Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days.

structured_content.content: This dish is not just a meal; it's a memory in the making. Sharing it with loved ones brings warmth and joy to our gatherings.
Consider adding a splash of balsamic vinegar for extra depth or a sprinkle of crushed red pepper for a hint of heat. Fresh herbs like parsley can also brighten the dish.
Serve this dish with a side of roasted vegetables or a simple green salad. A glass of crisp white wine pairs beautifully with the flavors.
For a gluten-free option, ensure your apple cider is gluten-free. You can also substitute chicken with tofu for a vegetarian twist while maintaining the same delicious glaze.

upload.context: A short description for the alt image of the final plated dish or variation.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• For restaurant-quality results, sear the chicken well to develop flavor.
  • Let the chicken marinate in the cider for a few hours for maximum flavor.
  • Keep an eye on the cooking time to prevent overcooking.
  • Garnish with fresh herbs for an impressive presentation.

structured_content.content: Don't hesitate to try this recipe; it's easier than you think and will surely impress your family. Enjoy the process and the delicious results!
